stanfordlogic.knowledge
Class BasicKB

java.lang.Object
  stanfordlogic.knowledge.KnowledgeBase
      stanfordlogic.knowledge.BasicKB

public class BasicKB
extends KnowledgeBase

A basic knowledge base implementation. Uses a mapping of relation name to set of things true in that relation.

For example: 

   true
    |- init(1,1,b) ; init(1,2;x) ; init(1,3,o) ; ...
   succ
    |- 1,2 ; 2,3 ; 3,4 ; ...

Author:
Based on code by Team Camembert: David Haley, Pierre-Yves Laligand

setFalse

public void setFalse(GroundFact fact)
Description copied from class: KnowledgeBase
Mark a given fact as 'false' in the current state. Note that given 'negation as failure' this means the same thing as removing a fact from the database.

Specified by:
setFalse in class KnowledgeBase
Parameters:
fact - Fact to set as false.

getIterator

public java.util.Iterator<GroundFact> getIterator()
Description copied from class: KnowledgeBase
Get an iterator for the facts in this knowledge base. Contrary to getFacts(), this method tries to create the smallest amount of memory possible. The iterator is backed by the kb's facts, which means that if you change the kb during iteration the state of the iterator will probably be undefined.

Specified by:
getIterator in class KnowledgeBase
Returns:
An iterator over the kb facts.
